http.title: Test Page for the Apache HTTP Server on Red Hat Certified Stacks
http.html:
Red Hat Certified Stacks Test Page

This page is used to test the proper operation of the Apache HTTP server after it has been installed. If you can read this page, it means that the Apache HTTP server installed at this site is working properly.

If you are a member of the general public:

The fact that you are seeing this page indicates that the website you just visited is either experiencing problems, or is undergoing routine maintenance.

If you would like to let the administrators of this website know that you've seen this page instead of the page you expected, you should send them e-mail. In general, mail sent to the name "webmaster" and directed to the website's domain should reach the appropriate person.

For example, if you experienced problems while visiting www.example.com, you should send e-mail to "webmaster@example.com".

For information on Red Hat Certified Stacks, please visit the Red Hat, Inc. website. The documentation for Red Hat Certified Stacks is available on the Red Hat, Inc. website.

If you are the website administrator:

You may now add content to the directory /var/www/html/. Note that until you do so, people visiting your website will see this page, and not your content. To prevent this page from ever being used, follow the instructions in the file /etc/httpd/conf.d/welcome.conf.

You are free to use the image below on web sites powered by the Apache HTTP Server:

http.html:
• EERE Home
  • Programs & Offices
  • Consumer Information

Building Energy Codes

Building Energy Codes Program
  • Home
  • Events
  • About
U.S. Department of Energy » Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy » Building Technologies Office » BECP Home
  • Site Map
  • Printable Version
  • Development
  • Adoption
  • Compliance
  • Resource Center
  • 2019 National Energy Codes Conference

    The 2019 National Energy Codes Conference, hosted by the U.S. Department of Energy, will take place May 28-30, 2019, in Denver Colorado.    
    Learn more...
  • Troubleshooting REScheck and COMcheck Projects

    This webinar, which will take place on May 9, 2019, will present case studies reviewing challenges that can be addressed via REScheck and COMcheck software. Valuable troubleshooting techniques will also be presented using samples based on real-world projects.    Learn more...
  • How Much Do Energy Codes Save?

    Building energy codes will save U.S. home and business owners $126 billion through 2040.  Learn more...
  • ANSI/ASHRAE/IES Standard 90.1-2016 Determination

    On February 27, 2018, DOE issued a notice of determination that Standard 90.1-2016 would achieve greater energy efficiency in buildings subject to the code.   Learn more...
  • BUILDING ENERGY CODES: How Are They Adopted?

    U.S. Department of Energy article takes a look at the building energy codes adoption process at the federal, state, and local levels.  Learn more...

Saving Energy

Highlights

  • 2019 National Energy Codes Conference
  • ANSI/ASHRAE/IES Standard 90.1-2016 Determination
  • The Impact of Building Energy Codes
  • Upcoming Training Events & Available Resources
  • Energy Code Field Studies

  • Read more about Saving Energy
